intro: Mesosetum filifolium, commonly known as the silky bluestem, is a perennial grass native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its fine, silky hairs covering its leaves and stems, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and disturbed sites, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Mesosetum filifolium is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
